item.title: Report X-2024100899
item.description:
Report X-2024100899

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-17T09:14:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-04
  • City: LAUREL
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER CALLED TO SMOKING PACKAGE IN A MOOSE UNLOADING AT AI1. RESPONDED WITH FULL PPE, DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET. UPON ARRIVAL MADE THE DETERMINATION FROM OUTER MARKINGS THAT PACKAGE CONTAINED 2 FIRE EXTINGUISHERS. ANY RESIDUE WAS COMPLETLY COTAINED WITHIN THE PACKAGE AND THAT THERE WAS NO EXTERNAL LEAKAGE. CONTAINED IN A BAG AND SPILL TUB AND RETURNED TO DMP FOR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2024100353
item.description:
Report E-2024100353

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-16T09:16:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-24
  • City: JESSUP
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 09:19 EST, XPO Logistics (XJP) called about a cargo release. It was reported due to a nail puncture from the pallet, approximately 2 gallons of DART 444 (hazardous - UN3266) was released. The caller stated the released product was contained to the dock floor and had been cleaned and contained by the terminal. The released product, damaged drum, and oil-dri were placed into a 75-gallon poly drum and staged at the terminal for management to handle. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release.
